text: Lygia Fagundes da Silva Telles ( de Azevedo Fagundes; ; April 19, 1918 — April 3, 2022) was a Brazilian novelist and writer. She won the Camões Prize. She was elected as the third woman in the Brazilian Academy of Letters in 1985. She was also nominated for the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2016. Telles died on April 3, 2022 in São Paulo, Brazil two weeks before her 99th birthday. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Writers from São Paulo Category:Brazilian centenarians
